New Records: India registered their highest ever score against Australia in the T20I.
India became the first team to fail to defend 200-plus totals in T20Is at home more than once in a calendar year.
India is only the second team after South Africa in 2016 among full members of the ICC to end up on the losing side despite posting 200 or more on the board.
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya scored 71 runs off 30 balls.
Cameron Green scored 61 runs off 30 balls.
Axar Patel took 3 wickets for 17 runs in 4 overs.
Nathan Ellis took 3 wickets for 30 runs in 4 overs.
Australia chased down 209 against India to take a 1-0 series lead in Mohali.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the batters for posting a 200-plus score while adding that the bowlers were not up to the mark and the fielding did not help as well.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that the dew was not a big factor and credited Australia for the way they batted.
Rohit Sharma expressed that the game was a great opportunity to understand what went wrong.
Rohit Sharma praised Hardik Pandya for his 71-run knock and emphasized the need to look at the bowling woes before the second T20I.
